I am troubled when I see so many ways devised to expend means which, from the light God has been pleased to give me, will result in very little advancement unto eternal life. I know that other methods could be devised that would be less expensive and would leave a much better after-influence.-- Letter 3, 1899, pp. 12, 13, (To J. H. Kellogg, January 5, 1899.) 


                                      -82-
